intro: Stylidium rupestre, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and produces small, showy yellow flowers. The plant has hairy, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid conditions. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Stylidium rupestre is a member of the family Malvaceae and is known for its ability to survive in harsh environments.
